item.name: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee
Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

summary.text:
Applauds public and private school officials who are trying to improve the history curriculum in secondary schools in the United States

Calls on school officials to reexamine such curriculum to ensure fair and up-to-date teaching of the developments of modern day Russia.

Calls on publishers of history textbooks to include more information and additional points of view regarding Russian history in new versions of textbooks or as supplementary materials.

bill.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives in support of providing fair and up-to-date teaching in United States secondary schools of the developments of modern day Russia.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
